channel.title: Fasting
channel.description:
The preacher today was talking about fasting in his sermon today as an overall general basis of not doing something for a given time to show devotion to something else.(so aka doesn't have to be food )
I would love to get a debate started on what you believe fasting is for, how it should be practiced, and etc. Any fasting related topics can be posted in here.
For my own personal beliefs I see it as a way to "get unaddicted" so to speak. I actually may try to "fast porn" for a week or something not sure haha.

On Topic: It’s sort of like taking a vow to do something and actually making yourself do it. You’re challenging yourself and reinforcing it to make yourself a ‘stronger and better’ person. Not to mention a much hungrier person as well.

Examples:

Vows of silence
Vows of celibacy
etc.

item.description:

Well what Romans says about it, yes. It’s a vague topic, but as we’ve seen examples of people doing it in those times, that’s just what we’ve adapted it as. From a non-Christians perspective, fasting is just giving up something to show dedication to other things, or as a time for self-mediation. Which ironically is extremely close to the Christian view.
